Class LPParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • LPParser

  • public class LPParser
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses the URL class to create a BufferedReader of the source code of a page from Liquipedia. It then parses through this source to get information about Players, Games, and Tournaments.

    The functionality of the parsing methods rely upon the URL being formed correctly. If you call one of these methods without first checking the parser for isValid() the output of the parsing methods is not guaranteed and it may crash. Parse methods will check isValid() before executing, and will throw an Exception if it fails.

    This class is immutable

    Made for MHacks - Fall 2013

    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    packrat386
    See Also:
    URL, BufferedReader

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LPParser()
      Default Constructor sets target to "http://wiki.teamliquid.net/" and opens input.
      LPParser(java.lang.String nick)
      Initializes target based on the provided nick, and opens input This Construcor also reads through input looking for the landmarks used in the parse methods and populates info.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LPParser

        public LPParser()
        Default Constructor sets target to "http://wiki.teamliquid.net/" and opens input. Sets valid to false necessarily.

      • LPParser

        public LPParser(java.lang.String nick)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Initializes target based on the provided nick, and opens input This Construcor also reads through input looking for the landmarks used in the parse methods and populates info. If some of the landmarks are not present then the parser is marked invalid. If the page gives another page to redirect to, that data is saved in redirect.
        Parameters:
        nick - In game nickname used to search for a player on Liquipedia.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        Returns true if the parser's search is well formed

      • getRedirect

        public java.lang.String getRedirect()
        Returns the redirect string given by the compiler. If no redirect string was found, its value will be null
        Returns:
        this.redirect
